intro: Senecio oliganthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features linear, narrow leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Senecio oliganthus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand drought.
